alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:21AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, within Grand County, along the Dolores River from the UT/CO stateline to the confluence with the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from snowmelt. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 AM MDT, gauge reports indicated snowmelt. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Granite Creek, Colorado River, Waring Canyon, Dolores River and Fisher Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Grand County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
